conclusion: Analyze the flow direction and path of liquid through baffles A, B, C, and D to determine which container (E, F, or G) it will flow into.
Baffle A: The liquid flows horizontally from left to right.
Baffle B: The liquid flows vertically downward.
Baffle C: The liquid flows horizontally from left to right.
Baffle D: The liquid flows vertically downward.
After Baffle A: The liquid will flow horizontally to the right.
After Baffle B: The liquid will flow vertically downward.
After Baffle C: The liquid will flow horizontally to the right.
After Baffle D: The liquid will flow vertically downward.
Outflow Point E: This point is on the left side of the image and does not align with any of the vertical or horizontal paths created by the baffles.
Outflow Point F: This point is in the middle of the image and aligns with the horizontal path created by Baffle C.
Outflow Point G: This point is on the right side of the image and aligns with the horizontal path created by Baffle A.
The liquid will flow into Container F because it aligns with the horizontal path created by Baffle C.
Final Answer: The liquid will flow into Container F.
